![Laseonjae (ÌïúÍµ≠Ïó≠ÏÇ¨Î¨∏ÌôîÏùåÏãùÌïôÍµê ÎùºÏÑ†Ïû¨)](/2022-12-03-1670038628325/2493528_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Housed in the Culinary School of Korea History and Culture in Gyeongju, the Laseonjae restaurant serves unique culinary delights that recreate the cuisine served in the royal courts of the Silla Kingdom. The school has a well-established reputation as a culinary institution that excels in preserving the taste and cooking styles of the past. Laseonjae was opened with the goal of promoting Isageum, the Silla-style course meal that the school developed after many years of research.
The Isageum table consists of various dishes served in the royal court of Silla the dishes are made of nine rare, medicinal ingredients called gujinmi. The interior of Laseonjae is decorated mostly in gold, the color that defines the Silla Kingdom. Note the columns with lotus leaf patterns and other characteristics unique to banquet halls from the Silla royal court. The restaurant staff further portrays the splendor of the era by wearing traditional Shilla dress, seemingly transporting diners back in time while they enjoy an elegant and delicious meal experience. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-54-771-6005| |opendate:|May18, 2009| |parking:|Available| |restdate:|Weekends & public holidays| |usetime:|09:00-18:00| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Available Facilities:|Lecture room, reference room, sotdanji museum, fermentation room for medicinal seasonings| ## Detail Image ![/2022-12-03-1670038628325/969432_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-03-1670038628325/969432_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-03-1670038628325/969436_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-03-1670038628325/969436_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-03-1670038628325/969445_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-03-1670038628325/969445_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-03-1670038628325/969446_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-03-1670038628325/969446_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-03-1670038628325/977447_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-03-1670038628325/977447_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-03-1670038628325/977478_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-03-1670038628325/977478_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-03-1670038628325/2493529_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-03-1670038628325/2493529_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-03-1670038628325/2493531_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-03-1670038628325/2493531_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-03-1670038628325/2493532_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-03-1670038628325/2493532_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-12-03-1670038628325/977646_image2_1.webp](/2022-12-03-1670038628325/977646_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-54-771-6005](tel:+82547716005) - [üè†www.culinaryschool.co.kr](http://www.culinaryschool.co.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 35.8435831096 longitude: 129.2865888157 title: 424-33, Bomun-ro, Gyeongju-si, Gyeongsangbuk-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
From Seoul Express Bus Terminal, take a bus to Gyeongju Bus Terminal.
From across the Gyeongju Bus Terminal, take Bus No. 10 and get off at Gyeongbuk Tourism Development Corporation Bus Stop.
The venue will be located on the left.

data.title: Laseonjae (ÌïúÍµ≠Ïó≠ÏÇ¨Î¨∏ÌôîÏùåÏãùÌïôÍµê ÎùºÏÑ†Ïû¨)
data.description:
Housed in the Culinary School of Korea History and Culture in Gyeongju, the Laseonjae restaurant serves unique culinary delights that recreate the cuisine served in the royal courts of the Silla Kingdom. The school has a well-established reputation as a culinary institution that excels in preserving the taste and cooking styles of the past. Laseonjae was opened with the goal of promoting Isageum, the Silla-style course meal that the school developed after many years of research.
The Isageum table consists of various dishes served in the royal court of Silla the dishes are made of nine rare, medicinal ingredients called gujinmi. The interior of Laseonjae is decorated mostly in gold, the color that defines the Silla Kingdom. Note the columns with lotus leaf patterns and other characteristics unique to banquet halls from the Silla royal court. The restaurant staff further portrays the splendor of the era by wearing traditional Shilla dress, seemingly transporting diners back in time while they enjoy an elegant and delicious meal experience.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Rock-carved Standing Buddha in Icheon-dong, Andong (ÏïàÎèô Ïù¥Ï≤úÎèô ÎßàÏï†Ïó¨ÎûòÏûÖÏÉÅ)
dataList.description: Maaekseobulsang (Rock-carved Standing Buddha) in Icheon-dong, Andong is also referred to as Jebiwon Statue due to the small temple of the same name nearby. This statue is unique as the head and the body are not carved from the same rock. The head was carved from a different rock then placed over a large rock relief of the Buddhas body. This type of technique is frequently found in those built during the Goryeo dynasty. The distinct features and carving methods that can be observed from this particular statue are speculated to be from the 11th century. Although there is a small amount of damage on the back of the head, the statue is well-preserved overall.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Pohang Canal (Ìè¨Ìï≠Ïö¥Ìïò)
dataList.description: Pohang Canal, completed in January 2014, cuts between Pohangs Songdo-dong and Jungdo 1-dong, connecting the waters under Dongbindaegyo Bridge with Hyeongsangang River to the south. The canal has a total length of 1.3km, adding on to the 8~10 km long seafaring road of Pohang. The canal is a restoration of an old water path, and the citizens have welcomed the eco-friendly construction as a community park. Many people enjoy walking along the canal or the romantic experience of riding on a cruise ship through the canal.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Pocheongyegok Valley (Ìè¨Ï≤úÍ≥ÑÍ≥°)
dataList.description: Pocheongyegok Valley is a representative valley of Gayasan Mountain with clear water and a lush forest. The valley used to be a learning place for local scholars in the old days. Eungwa Lee Wonjo, a civil minister and a great scholar during the late Joseon period, spent the later years of his life at Mangwijeong Pavilion located along the upper steam near a small waterfall. The beautiful valley scenery stretches over 7 kilometers.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Palgongsan Provincial Park (Gatbawi Section) (ÌåîÍ≥µÏÇ∞ÎèÑÎ¶ΩÍ≥µÏõê(Í∞ìÎ∞îÏúÑÏßÄÍµ¨))
dataList.description: Located north of Gyeongsan, Palgongsan Mountain (altitude 1,192.3 meters) was called both Jungaksan and Buaksan Mountain during the Silla period. The mountain has many ancient temples and historical sites such as the Gatbawi Stone Buddha, Wonhyosa Temple, Cheonseongsa Temple and Bulgulsa Temple.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Nari Basin (ÎÇòÎ¶¨Î∂ÑÏßÄ)
dataList.description: Originally a caldera formed on the northern Seonginbong Peak, Nari Basin is the only flatland on Ulleungdo Island. The lava flow from the volcanic eruption created two other craters, which were turned into Nari Village in the northeast and Albong Village, now uninhabited, in the northwest. Records were found that the island was inhabited since the Usan-guk period, but the islanders had to move out of the island in the earlier Joseon period until a new settlement policy was enforced later on.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Najeong Beach (ÎÇòÏ†ïÍ≥†Ïö¥Î™®ÎûòÌï¥Î≥Ä)
dataList.description: Najeong Beach is situated on the shores of the East Sea. The beach offers many facilities as well as a seawater hot spring. The parking lot and pine tree forest by the hot spring are open to the public. Various water sports are also available in the area.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Naeyeonsan County Park (ÎÇ¥Ïó∞ÏÇ∞Íµ∞Î¶ΩÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: Naeyeonsan Mountain in Pohang, Gyeongsangbuk-do is located near the coast. Hywangrobong Peak, the highest peak, is 930 meters above sea level. The mountain has various attractions including ancient Bogyeongsa Temple, 12 waterfalls, and Cheonghagol Valley.
dataList.author: korea-tour
